intro: Landolphia foretii, commonly known as the African star apple or African custard apple, is a tropical shrub native to central and western Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces a fleshy, sweet-tasting fruit with a star-shaped exterior, which is edible and often used in local cuisines. It thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found in forested or semi-deciduous areas.
